archimate:Requirement.name: 4.68.3 Security event data control
archimate:Requirement.documentation:
Appropriate security-related event data should be collected from numerous sources, including:
a) application logs (e.g. those generated by email and web servers, enterprise applications such ERM and CRM, and customised applications) b) system logs (e.g. system activity logs, computing device logs, authentication logs and physical security logs) c) network equipment logs (e.g. those generated by routers, firewalls, web proxy servers and network gateways) d) technical logs (e.g. those generated by servers supporting DNS, DHCP, FTP and SQL) e) security product logs (e.g. those generated by malware protection software, Data Leakage Prevention (DLP) and Network Intrusion Detection (NIDS)) f) threat intelligence (e.g. information about adversarial threats' past, present and predicted attacks to inform decisions or actions) g) contextual information (e.g. vulnerability scans, penetration testing results and HR feeds).
